content.title: On Learning the Structure of Clusters in Graphs
A Tighter Analysis of Spectral Clustering, and Beyond
Is the Algorithmic Kadison-Singer Problem Hard?
A Tighter Analysis of Spectral Clustering, and Beyond
Finding Bipartite Components in Hypergraphs
content.abstract: Hypergraphs are important objects to model ternary or higher-order relations of objects, and have a number of applications in analysing many complex datasets occurring in practice.  In this work we study a new heat diffusion process in hypergraphs, and employ this process to design a polynomial-time algorithm that approximately finds bipartite components in a hypergraph.  We theoretically prove the performance of our proposed algorithm, and compare it against the previous state-of-the-art through extensive experimental analysis on both synthetic and real-world datasets. We find that our new algorithm consistently and significantly outperforms the previous state-of-the-art across a wide range of hypergraphs.

content.title: Local Algorithms for Finding Densely Connected Clusters
